Thomas SMETS wrote:

> Hi MikeThese mails should probably be posted on an Advanced ML like
> the Advance-java@yahoogroups.com, instead. I read the paper you
> advised & drew some conclusion on my app design.Could you tell me if
> I'm right or not ? Problem statement :  The Data class allows to
> access Data in a formatted file (similar to DBF).  Change request is
> to enable multiclient simultaneous access. Solution 1 :  Singelton is
> right but throws too much code dependencies in the system which  as a
> direct consequence of making unit testing rather painfull when there
> is  some (more) change requests.   singelton has something fundamently
> wrong :    class do not need to know how they are used.    Access to
> single instance should be made via a ToolBox returning    instances of
> the class as requested. Solution 2 :    Client code should be told to
> access the class via an external Factory.    Problem is not yet
> perfectly solved. I cannot formalize yet the next step in the logic,
> but I more or less consider it as making a move from a Factory to a
> method factory. I probably need a few more days to grasp the internals
> of that. I also wonder why the code talks straight to the instance
> rather that to interfaces.Though slightly slower, that would be to me
> the ultimate abstraction in the system more than the method
> factory. Do you agree with that ?
